topic: How to combine _json with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to combine _json with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)

response_parsed.title: Combining json and Typing in Python 3.12+ for Production Code
response_parsed.summary: This explainer demonstrates the integration of json and Type Hints (typing) for efficient, error-free production code in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Using type hints to enhance readability and maintainability of your code
Incorporating typing modules within json functions for type safety
Improving interoperability with third-party libraries requiring type annotations

code_examples.code:
from typing import List, TypedDict, Any

class JsonData(TypedDict):
    id: int
    name: str
    value: float

def read_data(file: str) -> List[JsonData]:
    with open(file, 'r') as f:
        data = json.load(f)
        return [JsonData(**item) for item in data]

caveats: Ensure that all third-party libraries used in your project also support type hints
